column4: I just installed, and its booted into X, apparently I only have 9MB mem free, out of 1gig
Yes, that's fine.
9MB free, out of 1gig? That doesn't really seem fine
linux is not as stupid as Windows. it's using your "free" ram as disk cache. When an application needs it, it will be freed.
ok, that makes more sense, just seems unusual, never had a linux box doing this before
Was that via 'free' or via other utils?
Then my guess is that you previously had buggy vm behaviour.
Yes, you forgot to enable HIGHMEM 4GB
looks like your kerel didn't find all ram (or do you have integrated vga?)
I always wondered what that did
I dont have integrated mem, I should have a gig of mem there :/
Without that option you can only access about 986 or so MB ram.
Then yeah, you need to set HIGHMEM to 4, recompile and reboot.
Precompiled ubuntu kernels already have that enabled.
then why do I only have 900MB of ram or so it tells me?
You on the -386 installer kernel still?
I just installed, so I'm not sure
Then yes. Install a kernel for your cpu and you'll be fine.
'apt-cache search linux-image' should give you  alist of kernels to pick from.
thanks, I was just googling that
-686 for p2,p3,p4. k7 for athlon.
